Package com.rli.connectors.changeevent

This module contains the ChangeEvent class (and other supporting classes) which is the essential object used in the synchronization pipelines.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ChangeEvent
    A change event represents a single event (an entry that was inserted/updated/deleted/moved) captured on a backend, or an operation (insert/update/delete/move an entry) to apply on a backend.
    ChangeEvent.ChangeEventDeserializer
    Implementation of a JsonDeserializer (com.fasterxml.jackson.databind) for ChangeEvent objects.
    ChangeEvent.ChangeEventSerializer
    Implementation of a JsonSerializer (com.fasterxml.jackson.databind) for ChangeEvent objects.
    ChangeEventUtils
    This class provides helper methods that work with ChangeEvent objects.
    ComplexValueUtils
    This class provides helper methods that work with ComplexValue objects.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    ChangeMode
    Enumeration that controls the behavior of the apply connector when it receives a ChangeEvent.
    EventType
    Enumeration that represents the different types of change that can be applied or captured on a backend entry.

Package com.rli.connectors.changeevent Description

This module contains the ChangeEvent class (and other supporting classes) which is the essential object used in the synchronization pipelines.

The ChangeEvent object is used by capture connectors to describe a specific event of change (an entry that was inserted, updated or deleted) detected on a backend. This same class is also used by apply connectors to apply a specific change (insert, update, or delete an entry) on a backend.

In a synchronization pipeline, the following capture-transform-apply process occurs:
1. An event is detected on a source backend by a capture connector. This is represented as a ChangeEvent object.
2. In the transform phase, the ChangeEvent produced in step 1 is transformed into a new ChangeEvent object that is then sent to the apply connector.
3. The apply connector applies the ChangeEvent object produced in step 2. This results in an operation that is executed on a target backend.
